detected_integrations.description: Leave Policies are configured within Settings > Leaves section. All policy creation and editing occurs in this module.
Holiday calendars are linked to leave policies to automatically exclude holidays from leave calculations. Holidays are deducted from working days when calculating daily pay.
Leave policies determine eligibility and restrictions for leave requests. Changing policy calculation methods recalculates existing leave requests and moves them to Pending state.
Leave policies are activated per employee in their profile Leaves tab. Probation dates and employee hire dates affect leave accrual calculations.

Unpaid leave policies require payroll module to be enabled. Automatic salary deductions for unpaid and partially paid leaves are calculated and applied during payroll processing based on daily wage (basic salary ÷ 30 days).
Individual employee leave management and balance tracking occurs in the Time Off tab, which displays leave policies configured in Settings.
Leave calculation methods (calendar vs working days) depend on company's configured work week and holiday settings.
Leave requests can be submitted and managed through both web and mobile app interfaces. Line managers can use mobile app Manager View to approve team leave requests.
Leave policy setup requires pre-configured employee salaries to calculate daily wage deductions for unpaid and partially paid leaves.
Line Manager permissions are assigned through Role Management to enable managers to approve leave requests.
Employee profiles store reporting line information ('Reports to' field) which defines the leave approval workflow.
Notifications are sent to employees when leave requests are approved/rejected and when public holidays are modified.
Bulk upload of reporting hierarchies and leave report downloads use Excel templates and exports.
Core module for leave request management, calendar views, and leave balance tracking
Tracks late arrivals, early departures, and absences; feeds data to deduction policy calculations
Hierarchical approval process for leave requests; required before payroll deductions are created
Manages health insurance policy assignments and group policy placement workflows
Ensures attendance policies and leave accrual pausing comply with local labor law requirements
Reviews and provides feedback on health insurance policy placement documents
Receive policy placement documents and provide approval feedback for group health insurance
Leave policy modifications can conflict with existing leave requests. Policy changes may unintentionally unassign employees or erase leave balance history.
Leave policies must support regional labor law requirements (KSA, UAE, PH). Current system lacks native support for jurisdiction-specific accrual rules and public holiday compensation.

Leave calculations do not dynamically account for shift scheduler day-off configurations. The system cannot integrate shift schedule data to adjust working day calculations for employees with complex shift patterns.

what_to_do.task: Configure leave policy calculation method (calendar vs working days)
steps: Navigate to Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies
Edit an existing leave policy or click 'Add New' to create one
Select calculation method: Calendar Days (all days including weekends/holidays) or Working Days (business days only)
Optionally configure public holiday handling and exclusions
Review impact: changing calculation method will move existing leave requests to Pending state for recalculation
Save policy configuration
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Leave policy is configured with chosen calculation method. Existing leave requests are recalculated and moved to Pending state. Employees see updated leave balances based on new calculation method.
rules_and_constraints: Leave can be calculated as either Calendar days or Working days, not both
Calendar days count all days including weekends and holidays
Working days only count business days
Per U.A.E. Labor Law, annual leave can be 30 Calendar Days OR 22 Working Days
Calculation depends on company's specific work week and holiday configuration
Option to restrict employees from editing computed leave days
edge_cases: Enabling the feature will recalculate existing leave requests
Affected leave requests will be moved to Pending state
Calculation depends on company's specific work week and holiday configuration

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Policy Attributes Cannot Be Modified After Creation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Once a leave policy is created with an accrual type, leave type status (paid/unpaid), or leave cycle, these fundamental attributes cannot be changed. Users cannot convert between accrual methods, change leave type classification, or migrate leave cycles without losing all historical leave data. This creates a rigid system that does not accommodate organizational changes or corrections to initial configuration mistakes.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Immutability prevents disruption of employee leave balances and historical leave request integrity.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Carry-Over Allowance Updates Require Backend Intervention or Are Blocked
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Administrators cannot directly modify carry-over allowance settings through the user interface for most configurations. For companies using individual leave cycles, carry-over allowance modifications are completely blocked. Bulk updates require manual SQL execution or support team intervention, creating friction in leave policy maintenance workflows.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: Contact support team for backend SQL updates to carry-over allowance values.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Deleted Leave Policies Cannot Be Recovered; Policy Changes Erase Historical Data
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: When a leave policy is deleted, there is no self-service recovery mechanism. Associated leave requests and historical data cannot be fully restored, requiring manual recreation by support teams. Additionally, policy modifications can unintentionally unassign employees and erase leave balance history without providing a rollback or undo mechanism.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Balance Calculation Fails in Edge Cases
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system cannot automatically calculate leave balance when policies are configured before an employee's hire date, especially while the employee is inactive. When an employee's hire date is modified, leave cycles are not automatically recalculated for individual cycle employees. Additionally, the system enforces negative allowance limits rigidly and cannot permit leave beyond configured thresholds, even when business needs require flexibility.

The platform lacks native support for KSA labor law requirements, including automatic public holiday compensation when holidays fall on weekends and anniversary-based sick leave accrual cycles. The system defaults to calendar year or hire date-based accrual, which does not meet local regulatory requirements in KSA and PH jurisdictions.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Policy Configuration Complexity Lacks Clear Documentation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Multi-level leave policy configurations (policy-level vs. employee-level overrides) create confusion without transparent UI explanation. Conditional leave accrual logic, pro-rata calculations, and leave cycle mechanics lack clear user-facing documentation. Users cannot easily understand how accrual works across different leave cycles and tenure-based entitlement rules, particularly under UAE labor law.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Policies Cannot Be Manually Ordered in Employee View
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Employees see leave policies automatically sorted by update time, with no ability for administrators to manually prioritize or pin critical policies (e.g., annual leave). This prevents customization of policy visibility and importance in the employee self-service interface.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Type Restrictions and Granular Eligibility Logic Not Supported
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Administrators cannot configure restrictions on half-day leave requests at the policy level. The system lacks granular eligibility logic to distinguish between calendar days and working days, and cannot exclude specific leave types from threshold calculations. This limits customization of leave request rules.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Zero Values Not Correctly Handled in Encashable Days Configuration
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform has a UI limitation in handling zero values for maximum encashable days. When a policy is configured with zero maximum days, the system fails to correctly interpret and display encashable days, creating confusion in policy configuration.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Policy Modifications Blocked by Existing Leave Requests Without Reconciliation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system enforces rigid validation rules that prevent policy modifications when existing leave requests conflict with proposed changes. The platform does not automatically reconcile or adjust leave balances during policy reconfiguration, forcing administrators to manually resolve conflicts or abandon policy updates.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Granularity Below Half-Day Not Supported
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform cannot track leave in increments smaller than 0.5 days. Employees cannot request hourly leave or emergency leave lasting less than half a day, restricting flexible time management and preventing precise tracking of short-duration absences.

The platform cannot configure extreme carry-over allowances (e.g., 365+ days), modify carry-over balances for individual leave cycles, or provide granular carry-over controls through the UI. HR Admins cannot set custom carry-over limits without backend intervention or switching to calendar-based cycles.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Cycle Transition Causes Data Loss
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Transitioning between leave cycle types (e.g., individual to calendar) requires specialized configuration team intervention and results in loss of existing leave-related historical data. No seamless migration path exists for customers needing to change their leave cycle model.

Employees cannot self-service view detailed leave accrual breakdowns or understand how their leave is calculated. Documentation about carry-over behavior across policy types is unclear, and the platform lacks flexible leave counting rules beyond standard calendar or working day calculations. Support team members themselves report uncertainty about exact system behavior.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Shift Schedule Day-Offs Not Integrated in Leave Calculations
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform cannot dynamically adjust leave calculations based on shift scheduler day-off configurations. Employees with complex shift schedules cannot accurately track leave usage because the system rigidly applies the assigned workweek, ignoring actual shift schedule day-offs.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Policy Audit Trail & Change Transparency Missing
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks a user-accessible audit trail for leave policy modifications. Administrators and employees cannot independently view the history of policy changes, and users are not transparently informed when system actions automatically modify leave requests in the background. This requires backend database investigation by support teams.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Request Validation & Multi-Cycle Approval Gaps
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks automated validation for leave request timing relative to employee absences, requiring managers to manually review leave history. Additionally, leave salary requests split across different leave cycles cannot be consolidated or linked, forcing administrators to manually track and approve multiple related requests separately.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Automatic Leave Proration Conflicts with UAE Labor Law
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform automatically prorates leave balances based on hire date, which directly conflicts with UAE labor law requirements for maternity and sick leave. This prevents HR managers from configuring leave policies that grant full entitlements to employees as mandated by local regulations.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: System default behavior for pro-rata calculations
